Posted By: Zenzei (10/5/2011 10:52:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This pretty much won me a game at a sealed event I was in. (And helped me with a lot of others.)  
  
Turn one: This.  
Turn two: Curse of the Pierced Heart, attack. Opponent down to 18 in his turn, this at 2/2.  
Turn Three: Rakish Heir, attack with this (he couldn't block as he only had a human out). He's down to 14 (after the curse), this is 4/4.  
Turn four: Gruesome Deformity (either that, or he still only had humans, I don't remember exactly), he's down to 9, this is at 6/6 and I have a lot of new guys for the next turn).  
Turn five: He's dead.  
  
I agree that my opponent probably didn't have the best starting hand, which I pretty much had, so whatever. It's still cool.  
  
In another match, I killed my opponent's one several times with Geistflame, though. But then again, "Dies to removal" isn't really an argument.
posts.html:

Turn one: This.
Turn two: Curse of the Pierced Heart, attack. Opponent down to 18 in his turn, this at 2/2.
Turn Three: Rakish Heir, attack with this (he couldn't block as he only had a human out). He's down to 14 (after the curse), this is 4/4.
Turn four: Gruesome Deformity (either that, or he still only had humans, I don't remember exactly), he's down to 9, this is at 6/6 and I have a lot of new guys for the next turn).
Turn five: He's dead.

I agree that my opponent probably didn't have the best starting hand, which I pretty much had, so whatever. It's still cool.

In another match, I killed my opponent's one several times with Geistflame, though. But then again, "Dies to removal" isn't really an argument.

Unless your opponent has a 1 drop, this becomes a 2/2 at the end of turn 2. And it only gets worse from there if you don't have an answer.
